candidates.title: Replace unmaitained encoding crate with encoding_rs
candidates.body: This replaces the no longer maitained encoding crate with encoding_rs.

candidates.title: Fix Cargo.toml
candidates.body:
```log
Run cargo build --verbose 
error: failed to parse manifest at `/home/runner/work/lopdf/lopdf/Cargo.toml`

Caused by:
  could not parse input as TOML

Caused by:
  TOML parse error at line [4](https://github.com/J-F-Liu/lopdf/actions/runs/3747109580/jobs/6363023887#step:4:5)[6](https://github.com/J-F-Liu/lopdf/actions/runs/3747109580/jobs/6363023887#step:4:7), column 1
     |
  46 | default = ["chrono_time", "nom_parser", "rayon"]
     | ^
  Duplicate key `default` in table `features`
```

Signed-off-by: Hollow Man <hollowman@opensuse.org>

candidates.title: Add example extract_text
candidates.body: This example extracts text of whole PDF document and writes it into a JSON file.

candidates.title: Add function get_page_annotations and include an example
candidates.body: This patch adds a convenience function `get_page_annotations`. It includes a small example that prints a summary of PDF annotations to the terminal.

candidates.title: Fixed #175 and some clippy issues.
candidates.body:
I went thru and made sure the usize should not overflow is the i64 did ever become a negative.
Included a Test for TIFF6.pdf to test weezl. 
Fixed some more Clippy warnings for nightly Clippy.

candidates.title: Added documentation and improved tests
candidates.body:
- Added documentation (mainly for `Error`)
- Improved tests 
  - Files are created in system's temp folder instead of CWD.
  - Removed some unneeded tests (including tests if files can be deleted)
- Fixed some linting warnings.
- Added `forbid(unsafe_code)` because I don't see any reason we need unsafe code in this repo.
- Removed unused dependencies
- Added CI jobs

candidates.title: Remove unneccessary time 0.1 dependency
candidates.body: This is pulled in by chrono's default features.

candidates.title: Fix document save race in parser_aux::load_and_save and creator::create_document
candidates.body:
This fixes the race condition identified in issue 137:
https://github.com/J-F-Liu/lopdf/issues/137

There were several changes to fix the existing code and make adding new tests that create files more safe:

Make public helper functions to create and remove documents that can be called from other tests.
Put those helpers and the other unit tests in a tests namespace to make it clear they're for testing.
Use different filenames in different file tests (parser_aux and creator).
In creator, add a mutex around saving and reading files with the same filename.

Let me know if there are any questions or if you have any changes.

Thanks for the great work on this project.

candidates.title: Replace lzw with weezl
candidates.body:
Fixes: #138 

I'm unsure if this is covered by any tests. In any case, we could deactivate the `std` features if we manually do the output loop. There's not a lot to gain though. I'll also consider adding an `into_vec` adaptor to `weezl` that works with `alloc` alone and does not require the whole of `std`, let me know if this is of interest to you.

chosen_pr.title: Remove unneccessary time 0.1 dependency
chosen_pr.body: This is pulled in by chrono's default features.

chosen_detail.title: Remove unneccessary time 0.1 dependency
chosen_detail.body: This is pulled in by chrono's default features.
